title: newMarketing Systems Coordinator
company: Wild Rose College of Herbal Medicine
description:
Marketing Systems Coordinator

Company Profile:

Wild Rose College of Herbal Medicine is a Canadian-based online college that has been training herbalists since 1975. We are a dynamic, dedicated and hardworking team that prides itself on connecting plants and people.

At WRC, it is our mission to keep herbal knowledge alive and thriving and support its evolution for future generations. Our goal is to train herbalists in every community, creating resilient neighbourhoods and a more inclusive and self-sufficient healthcare model that is both adaptable and backed by science.

Role Overview:

The Communications Team is responsible for creating all communications and marketing strategies at Wild Rose College. We are the voice and tone of the college and are the point of contact with our community across a variety of communications channels. We pride ourselves on building community, providing engaging content, and setting an example for strong educational models and opportunities during the herb world in Canada.

Reporting to and working in tandem with the Communications Manager, you will be accountable for supporting the deliverance of compelling content via marketing funnels such as lead magnet strategies, direct email, lifetime communications and more within the Communications/Marketing department, across the stages of Wild Rose’s journey.

Your primary responsibility will be administration, technical support and delivery of marketing campaigns across messaging channels. You understand email marketing best practices as well as having experience in applying them. You have utilized digital platforms that support automation, email marketing, and cross-channel orchestration, and have experience creating and supporting lead magnet launches to successfully execute a variety of campaigns and marketing initiatives.

This role requires a combination of technical and marketing skills, and a background in creating digital marketing experiences, with an opportunity for growth within the role and the company.

Key Deliverables:

-Active Campaign support, management and administration in tandem with partners

-WordPress support & administration: product page creation, website edits and updates, SEO markups

-Supporting the creation, management and optimization of various marketing campaigns working in partnership with the Communications Manager

-Technical & logistical support for lead magnet development and lifecycle communications: landing pages, pop-ups/opt-ins, automations, webinars, free courses and downloads

-Experience with Landing Page builders (such as Elementor/AC) and Forms Builders (Ninja Forms, AC) & pop up plug-in & scheduler Hustle Pro (or similar)

-Support and testing channels, targeting, ad creative, and landing pages to drive improvement across all KPIs

-Creation and execution of email campaigns and automations in conjunction with the communications department, including scheduling, briefing of creative, campaign set up, QA/testing, execution and reporting

-Reviews deliverability performance for communication systems and works with appropriate teams or partners to optimize

-Engage with the Communications team to develop any new templates or concepts required

-Troubleshoot technical issues related to list segmentation, workflow configuration, HTML templates, and other aspects of digital communication executions, as required

-Developing and supporting reporting and analytics; reviewing deliverability performance for communication systems and working with appropriate teams to optimize

-Experience in supporting and delivering paid search (Google Ads) and paid social ads (Facebook/Meta) is considered an asset

Experience and Qualifications

  • Education in Marketing or Communications is considered an asset
  • Experience: Minimum 1.5-2 years in a role focused on direct email, CRM and marketing systems creation or support
  • Technical skills: Experience with Email Service Provider, Marketing Automation system (Active Campaign), and digital analytics platform. Ability to write technical requirements and SOPs
  • Marketing skills: experience in Digital Marketing including email, website, lead magnet support and development. Strong understanding of database concepts and segmentation. Ability to identify audience segments and opportunities within, as well as knowledge of email deliverability best practices and how to apply them

Business Acumen:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (both written and verbal)
  • Extreme attention to detail in all areas–including visual formatting
  • Resourceful and solutions-focused, with a track record of establishing respect and credibility through actions
  • Ability to support, develop and collaborate on tools, tasks, and systems with a higher-level birds-eye-view with all stakeholders
  • Comfortable identifying technical solutions/capably problem-solving systems and technical issues (along with any required tech support) for all marketing initiatives
  • Take pride in executing small tasks related to marketing administration
  • Proactive with an inquiring mind–you have drive and initiative, and take pride in task completion and measuring results
  • Exemplary self-organization, time management and project management skills
  • Ability to identify efficiencies, plan, communicate, and work efficiently
  • Comfortable working independently with minimal direction, as well as working collaboratively as a team and contributing to a healthy team environment
  • Strong ability to effectively multi-task and manage multiple projects and effectively meet deadlines
  • Have a sense of humour, be a great teammate and contribute to a great work culture

Skilled with:

Active Campaign | Google Suite | Sheets/Excel | Form Builders (Ninja Forms, AC) | Landing Page Builders (Elementor, AC, etc.) | Hustle Pro (or similar) Yoast SEO (or similar) | Trello/ Team Gantt) |

Familiarity with PS or Illustrator (photo resizing, basic edits, working on templates, etc) | Familiarity with FB/Meta Ads Manager Campaigns and Google Ads considered an asset

Hourly Rate: 23-25$/hr based on experience

Position Perks:

As a team member at Wild Rose College, you’ll enjoy:

-A remote work environment

-Flexible schedule (26-29 hours per week) with the opportunity to grow into FT hours

-Monthly phone & internet allowance

-Benefits (a health and lifestyle spending account)

Location: Online (Remote). Please note: Candidates must be based within Canada.

Contact/Application Information

If you check all of the above boxes– and in fact love everything this job posting entails and are excited to connect further, please send your resume along with a cover letter indicating previous and related work experience.

Submit both to General Manager Farrah Thompson by May 13th, 2022.

At Wild Rose College, we know that like any ecosystem, diversity is a strength and our workplace is no different. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable working and learning environment for our students, staff, and faculty, and are committed to the path of reconciliation in Canada. We believe every team member enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world.

We welcome submissions from a diverse range of qualified applicants and look forward to learning about you, your skills, how you envision yourself as part of our team and contributing to the growth of the college.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates who are selected will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00-$25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • marketing: 2 years (required)

title: E-commerce Brand Manager
description:
E-Commerce Brand Manager

Position Type: Permanent, Full-time

Wage: $75,000 per annum, to be reviewed after 90-days, annually thereafter

Start Date: Immediate

Location: Vancouver, BC

Who We Are:

Since 2001, Natural Wellbeing and Pet Wellbeing have been providing trusted and effective wellness support through our complete range of premium-quality natural health supplements. Our scientifically researched natural remedies are formulated by expert herbalists and holistic veterinarians. Our values include a commitment to our customers on the quality and effectiveness of our products, to the planet, and to giving back.

Our entire team works together very closely and everyone’s voice is valued, encouraged, and heard.

Who We Are Looking For:

The Pet Wellbeing Brand Manager is responsible for adapting and implementing our brand strategy in order to support sales growth goals, and ensure successful and on-time execution of marketing and corporate initiatives.

They will participate in brand strategy discussions and work with creative and marketing teams to ensure strategic objectives are met. As the 'brand guardian', this individual will help align the Brand across the organization and maintain integrity across all channels and platforms.

We possess a strong focus on continuous improvement, intellectual curiosity, and challenging the status quo. We are seeking a like-minded individual, and being a self-starter is a must! The successful candidate will be exceptionally well-organized and meticulously thorough. They must be able to effectively and respectfully communicate, both written and verbal, with all types of individuals. Being innovative and possessing strong problem-solving skills will benefit this position and lead to success in the role.

Responsibilities & Overview:

  • Overseeing and coordinating external agency partners on the development, design, and production of creative assets
  • Ensuring consistent messaging across all marketing, sales and corporate materials throughout the organization
  • Planning/forecasting and tracking/managing the marketing budget
  • Gathering, analyzing, and benchmarking competitors and pet industry insights, trends and data

Key Competencies:

  • Branding and Marketing Experience
  • Brand awareness - a clear understanding of Pet Wellbeing Brand and market mix
  • Strong design sense, creativity, and imagination
  • Demonstrate superior project management skills
  • Thorough understanding of Internet marketing tactics and KPIs
  • Relationship management skills, diplomacy
  • Determination, perseverance, focus, and efficiency
  • Results driven and ability to prioritize
  • A high degree of business acumen
  • Aligns well with Organizational Culture
  • Prior experience in the natural supplement industry
  • Understanding of regulatory environment in countries where we sell

Job Requirements (preferred):

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in a Brand Management role
  • Bachelor degree in business, marketing, or related field
  • Experience with new product launches, or launching a brand into a new market
  • Demonstrated project and budget management
  • Those with prior natural supplement experience will be considered first

Benefits (when position becomes permanent):

  • Paid vacation, sick & personal days, and statutory holidays
  • Health benefits (following 90 days of continuous employment)
  • Flexible work hours and location (home, office)
  • Access to health supplements in our product lines
  • On-site fitness centre and bike locker

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site gym
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Brand Management: 3 years (required)

title: Part-time CSR / Nutritionist (16 to 28 hours/week, closing s...
description:
The primary function of the Customer Service Representative / Nutritionist is to provide overall frontline customer care, through clear communication with customers, staff, and department managers. The role requires effectively delivering one-to-one and group information either in a preventative or a service capacity, and to achieve and maintain the highest level of customer satisfaction.

CSR/Cash Responsibilities

  • Excellent customer care aptitude in all avenues of customer interaction.
  • Research and update customer handout sheets.
  • Process customer requests i.e cooking class enrollment, mail outs, nutritional store tours (refer to department training binder.)
  • Various cashier duties: keying in or scanning the price of merchandise, receiving payments, bagging productivity
  • Receive, stock, and face appliances/department products.
  • Follow opening, closing, and cleaning procedures.
  • Facilitate and support the roles of the Department Manager and Head Nutritionist.
  • Completes all tasks as indicated by Department Manager, Head Nutritionists, and Standards Coordinator as required to fill the needs of the job.
  • Identify and offer accessibility customer service assistance to anyone entering the building that has a visible disability. Involves retrieving desired items or providing personal shopping assistance.

Nutritionist Responsibilities

  • Researching how the body’s functions are affected by nutrient supply, examining the process of nourishment, and the association between diet, disease and health.
  • Well-versed in current products, trends, and food issues as well as the store’s active projects and ongoing standards initiatives.
  • Investigating the relationship between genes and nutrients, studying how diet affects metabolism.
  • Providing health and wellness advice and promoting healthy eating and lifestyle.
  • Involvement in outreach projects in collaboration with the PR in the Marketing department.
  • Advising on specific diets and dietary needs.
  • Educating customers about nutrition.
  • Working as part of a multi-disciplinary team/supporting the work of other healthcare professionals (NDs, Herbalists).
  • Host store tours regarding specific and general food related or store topic.
  • Responsibilities may include any additional job-related duties as required by the Assistant Store Manager

Skills, Knowledge and Experience:

  • A degree in Holistic Nutrition from an accredited institution is required
  • Minimum of 2 years previous customer service experience or working one-on-one with the public is an asset.
  • Training, knowledge, and awareness of Canadian organic standards, genetically engineered foods and food security is an asset.
  • Teamwork skills demonstrated from past work experience an asset.
  • Good interpersonal, communication, and social skills.
  • Previous experience working with processing cash, debit and credit transactions an asset

The Big Carrot is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, let us know in advance and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Only those candidates who are shortlisted will be contacted for an interview.

Please note only those individuals legally entitled to work in Canada will be considered for employment with the Big Carrot.

title: Technology Teacher
description:
Position Overview:

As the Primary/Junior Technology Teacher you will have dual responsibilities to both academics and integration. In this role you will collaborate with other department members, School Leadership and the Director of Education to provide technology support to Primary Years colleagues, students and families. It includes a teaching component with the STEAM Curriculum. You will also support the implementation of UMS strategic plans including the creation of a sustainable, diverse, inclusive, equitable, and school program that is safe and welcoming for all.


Key Responsibilities:

Innovation and Information:

  • Lead the planning and integration of technology into the Grade 1 to Grade 3 classrooms;
  • Provide technology-related input to faculty, and identify new opportunities in the development of lesson plans and curricula, including integrating the use of technology into the curriculum;
  • Work with academic teams to ensure direction is given on current technology trends and opportunities;
  • Assess the technology skill levels of current staff and students, and recommend appropriate training and programming to support development of global technology citizenship;
  • Provide professional development and training for faculty in the use of technology in the classroom;
  • Develop learning resources for faculty and students – e.g. tutorials, manuals, websites and other interactive programs;
  • As part of a team of integrators, support innovative programs both in the Prep and across the College, to ensure colleagues are supported with technology;
  • Lead technology primary Grade committees as appropriate;
  • Participate in the long-term planning of technology resources for UMS, to enable enhanced teaching and learning methodology, including budget development;
  • As part of the I T department, work collegially as a team member to ensure the successful implementation of IT services at UMS.

Academic:

  • Teach Primary Technology classes;
  • Commitment to and understanding of differentiated education;
  • Collaborate with the Digital Learning Educator, Steam Specialist and colleagues, develop units of work, prepare lesson plans following Ontario ministry curriculum guidelines;
  • Deliver the program with an age-appropriate and inquiry-based approach;
  • Assess students’ progress, provide meaningful feedback, record results, and issue reports on progress;
  • Establish clear student expectations for the creation of a supportive, caring and effective teaching and learning environment;
  • Communicate regularly with students and parents on progress;
  • Use technology in the classroom to enhance learning and work with community members within and beyond the gates of UMS;
  • Keep up-to-date with developments in the subject area, teaching resources and related strategies, and make relevant changes to instructional plans and activities;
  • Engage meaningfully and humbly in faculty and professional meetings, educational conferences, and various professional development opportunities;
  • Collaborate with colleagues within the department and beyond, with humility and openness to feedback;
  • Establish effective, supportive and caring relationships with students;
  • Provide direction and support for all students, and employ strategies to seek out students who are not forthcoming;
  • Respond promptly to parent enquiries and concerns, developing collaborative and informed relationships, paying particular attention to families new to the College;
  • Ensure that school academic policies, practices and standards are maintained;
  • Demonstrate strong attention to detail, organization and planning;
  • Collaborate with all colleagues to ensure that students are being served well, and supported appropriately, across all subject areas;
  • Participate fully and collaboratively in a shared approach to the form advising programs, weekly routines and processes;
  • Lead conversations about race as it relates to student wellbeing and achievement and understand the impact of microaggressions on the wellbeing of marginalized people;
  • Work to identify strategies to support marginalized people, and change inequitable practices as they are identified;
  • Hold brave conversations about bias, power, privilege and barriers in service to students and families.

Co-curriculars, Coaching, and Supervision

  • Lead with skill, passion and enthusiasm, identified activities in our co-curricular program, including the arts and coaching. Arts and Coaching responsibilities are likely to include some evening and weekend activities;
  • Supervision duty as assigned;


Key Experience, Knowledge and Competencies:

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in classroom technology integration with learners and educators,
  • Technology related certification, specifically Google for education, Ontario Teaching certification and/or independent school experience an asset;
  • Strong knowledge and skill in a wide variety of current software and technologies (e.g. Productivity tools, operating systems, Learning Management Systems, digital video and editing, image processing, internet streaming, tablet technologies, various laptop applications, and sound/classroom systems), and their application in an educational setting; in order to identify and recommend enhanced technology options for curriculum development and delivery;
  • Knowledge and understanding of trends, teaching strategies and relevant research regarding the use and application of technology in the classroom from Casa to Grade 5, including the implementation of face-to-face and blended/hybrid environments;
  • Knowledge of teaching techniques and curriculum development, in order to recommend integration of technology;
  • Knowledge of Ontario Ministry curriculum & ICT standards an asset;
  • Ability to lead a team of staff/faculty that investigates and recommends on different aspects of design and technology;
  • Ability to analyze and evaluate situations in real time and to develop solutions;
  • Ability to identify and address concerns of parents and colleagues;
  • Ability to effectively engage in challenging conversations within the UMS community;
  • Ability to establish ongoing relationships with UMS staff, faculty, students, parents, third parties and external suppliers;
  • Ability to identify opportunities to enhance the school/college’s technology infrastructure to meet teaching/learning needs within established budgets, and/or develop business cases to support additional funding;
  • Ability to interact effectively with faculty to participate in and support technology integration in curriculum and lesson plan development;
  • Ability to deliver professional development and training to faculty and student in the use of technology, and to develop and provide supporting training materials;
  • Ability to lead Technology Committees in such as way that engages student in the use and application of technology to learning and everyday life;
  • Ability to present complex technical information to a variety of audiences, including developing and presenting business cases to support technology purchases;
  • Experience in championing equity, diversity, pluralism, and inclusion. Demonstrated experience in addressing structural and systemic bias that impacts marginalized communities is an asset.


If you are dedicated, hard-working, and interested in joining Unionville Montessori Private School, please forward your cover letter and resume. The commencement date of this position is September 2022.  

 

While all applicants are thanked for their interest, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Research Coordinator, Research on Teacher Design Development, Werklund School of Education
description:
Position Overview

The Werklund School of Education invites applications for a Research Coordinator. This Fixed Term Recurring Part-time position is for approximately 1 year (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension.

This position reports to research project principal investigators about work on their respective research projects. The specific projects will change over time as grants are completed and new grants are initiated by principal investigators in the Werklund School of Education. The Research Coordinator will work Monday to Friday up to 35 hours per week. The work environment requires the majority of time spent at a computer or on the telephone.

Position Description

Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):
  • Position is accountable to conduct high quality and rigorous analysis and synthesis of qualitative data
  • Use judgement to identify and resolve day-to-day technical and operational issues in coordinating research projects
  • Independent and self-directed with a high degree of creativity
  • Ability to deal with multiple simultaneous deadlines throughout the year
  • Exhibit characteristics of a professional concerning ethical research conduct
  • Participate in the core research team meetings involving approximately 5 researchers, partners, and research assistants; you will be expected to provide study updates and contribute to discussions
  • Assist to maintain fidelity with protocols for the research projects by managing research files and documents (both digital and physical) as outlined in the study protocol and ethics
  • Responsible to make recommendations to protocols or guidelines to increase the operational efficiency of research projects
  • Complete assigned and scheduled tasks under own initiative with limited direct supervision
  • Develop and implement literature review search strategies and environmental scans that support the project's development as well as future publications on the topic
  • Prepare submissions to the Research Ethics Board (REB) including the development of applications and related documents (consent forms, etc.)
  • Participate in the preparation of grant applications including writing and editing sections of the grant, joining team meeting about the grant
  • Develop research methodology and protocols
  • Coordinate and conduct data collection; develop recruiting materials (posters/brochures in PowerPoint or similar), recruit participants and obtain participant consent for focus group meetings
  • Conduct focus groups, interviews and observations with research participants using ZOOM or Microsoft Teams
  • Develop qualitative research analysis strategies and conduct analysis of qualitative data
  • Maintain detailed and organized project documentation (both electronic and physical files; includes storing and managing the files)
  • Contribute to manuscript preparation and knowledge translation including working with the team in developing academic publications based on the research as well as developing research posters and presentations based on study findings
Qualifications / Requirements
  • Doctorate (PhD or EdD) in Education or Associated Field
  • Experience analysing qualitative data in education or associated field
  • Experience conducting literature reviews
  • Strong writing skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to facilitate collaboration on the projects
  • Experience conducting research in the field of pre-service or in-service teacher preparation with a focus on supporting ideological change and or supporting teachers in reconsidering how they engage in design
  • Qualitative data collection experience
Application Deadline: May 19, 2022

We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.

Additional Information

This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the Specialist/Advisor Job Family, Phase 2.

To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Management and Staff Careers website. For more information about the Werklund School of Education, visit Careers in the Werklund School of Education.

The University strongly recommends all faculty and staff are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

About The University Of Calgary

The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university - a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.

The University of Calgary has launched an institution-wide Indigenous Strategy in line with the foundational goals of Eyes High, committing to creating a rich, vibrant, and culturally competent campus that welcomes and supports Indigenous Peoples, encourages Indigenous community partnerships, is inclusive of Indigenous perspectives in all that we do.

As an equitable and inclusive employer, the University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their academic and professional success while they are here. In particular, we encourage members of the designated groups (women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible/racialized minorities, and diverse sexual orientation and gender identities) to apply. To ensure a fair and equitable assessment, we offer accommodation at any stage during the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities. Questions regarding [diversity] EDI at UCalgary can be sent to the Office of Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (equity@ucalgary.ca) and requests for accommodations can be sent to Human Resources (hrhire@ucalgary.ca).

We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

title: Early Childhood Educator
description:
Kids U is a growing Accredited Early Childhood Learning Institute in Calgary and Strathmore. For children aged zero to six, we offer best-in-class child care as well as preschool and kindergarten programs that build experiences and influence the development of executive functions. Guided by our Core Values of Knowledge, Innovate, Development, Service and Upliftment, our curriculum is backed by scientific research and this approach prioritizes how a child learns instead of what they learn.

**Kids U has won the Gold Winner status for the Calgary Herald/Sun Readers choice awards! Best Daycare & Best Preschool 2021 !**

Our right-brain environment is inspired by the Reggio Emila philosophy of education, where creativity, imagination, social skills and children’s interests determine the curriculum. As a Lead Teacher, you will create an environment that inspires children to think outside of the box and explore and engage with their senses. Your role will be to observe, follow, and document the child’s interests and curiosities as they develop.
If you are passionate about teaching children and are driven by a desire to enhance early childhood education, Kids U is the place for you!

Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities

- Support the Lead Teacher in planning and implementing a Montessori program for preschool-aged children to stimulate the growth of executive functioning skills, cognitive flexibility, working memory and inhibitory control.
- Setting up classroom materials and planning activities for the children’s learning and development.
- Work cooperatively as a member of the childcare team, facilitating a team environment through personal behavior, work contributions, and the sharing of expertise and knowledge.
- Provide effective supervision, support classroom routines and maintain behavioral expectations with children.
- Coordinate and participate with parents and/or guardians to ensure the educational success of the child.
- Daily reporting and record-keeping, including daily attendance and communication logs, allergy, medication, and health records, and addressing all health and safety concerns.
- Participate in internal and external learning activities to increase knowledge and awareness of Early Childhood Education research.
- Assist children with self-help skills, including feeding, toileting and diapering.
- Make a difference in the lives of young children every day!

What You Bring (Preferred Skills and Qualifications)

- Formal education within Early Childhood Education (CDA, CDW or CDS).
- Early Childhood Educator Certificate (minimum Level 1).
- Minimum 1-year experience teaching preschoolers.
- Experience teaching within a Casa Montessori Environment is an asset.
- Current First Aid Certificate (may be obtained upon hire).
- Criminal Record Check/Vulnerable Sector Check, within the past 6 months.
- Knowledge of Kids U curriculum - Montessori (Left Brain), Movement, Reggio (Right Brain).
- Effective interpersonal skills, exhibiting a supportive and positive approach.
- Enthusiastic, engaging, and a passion about working with children.
- A flexible and positive attitude that is adaptable to change, stress, and daily challenges.
- Exceptional interpersonal skills, time management, problem-solving, and leadership abilities.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with
- children, parents, and colleagues.
- Ability to lift up to 40lbs., especially when working with infants and toddlers.

Our Offer

- You will be surrounded by the best-in-class Montessori educators and pedagogical leaders to share best practices and learn so as to enhance your class environment.
- Professional Development Days focused on best practices in early childhood education and new, innovative ways of teaching and learning.
- Annual Lead Teacher retreat focused on skills development.
- Compensation is based on education and experience.
- Benefits include vision, dental, and paramedical services.

(1-Year contract starting August 2022)


The York School is a co-educational, non-denominational, independent day school, renowned for its challenging academic International Baccalaureate (IB) programme and commitment to experiential learning – extending all over Toronto, Canada and the world. Our highly trained faculty receive support and training to be leading professionals in their fields and in the IB Curriculum, using cutting-edge classroom technology. 


Like our students, teachers at The York School are inquiring, knowledgeable, caring and engaged citizens of the world. Leaders in their field, they are open to change and committed to improving lives through education.


JOB PURPOSE:

The York School is looking for an experienced and inspirational teacher to be part of the Middle School faculty as a Science and Math Teacher. The successful candidate will have had training or successful experience at the Intermediate Level with the Middle Years Programme (MYP) and will be well-versed in project-based and experiential learning.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Teach Science and Math in the Middle or Senior School;
  • Teach within the IB (International Baccalaureate) framework and philosophy;
  • Participate in collaborative planning, committees and meetings;
  • Participate in co-curricular activities i.e. coaching, leading clubs; 
  • Supervision duties as well as other duties related to the position;
  • Facilitate a programme that values executive functioning skill development and social emotional learning;
  • Offer extra-help sessions for students;
  • Support and take an active role in the initiatives of the Science Department;
  • Participation in field trips and experiential learning (and overnight) opportunities;
  • Coaching & participation in the school community;
  • Attendance at meetings, parent evenings, and other events as required;
  • Familiarity with experiential learning and progressive pedagogical methods.


QUALIFICATIONS AND ATTRIBUTES:

  • Must have an Ontario College of Teachers (OCT) Certificate (Intermediate or Senior Divisions);
  • Bachelor’s degree with specialization in math or science;
  • Minimum 2 years experience teaching science;
  • Training and experience teaching the IB (International Baccalaureate) MYP (Middle Years Programme) and/or DP (Diploma Program) considered an asset;
  • Strong ability to work as part of a collaborative team;
  • Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills;
  • Ability to interact with students, parents and teachers cheerfully, enthusiastically, courteously, patiently and with discretion;
  • Strong organizational and time management skills;
  • A proactive team player who is flexible and self-motivated with a “How can I help?” attitude;
  • Proficiency in Google Suite considered an asset.


THE YORK SCHOOL'S CORE COMPETENCIES:

  • Flexibility & Adaptability
  • Breadth of Contribution
  • Relationship Focused
  • Service Orientation
  • Communication & Collaboration Inclusivity
  • Integrity & Trust

THE YORK SCHOOL'S FACULTY COMPETENCIES:

  • Planning & Preparation for Student Learning 
  • Delivery of Instruction 
  • Managing Classroom Culture & Environment 


OIN OUR COMMUNITY:

Employees at The York School are inquiring, knowledgeable, caring and engaged citizens of the world. Leaders in their field, they are collaborative, open to change and committed to improving lives through education. We are committed to professional development, and provide a competitive compensation and benefit package to our employees. 


THE YORK SCHOOL VALUES DIVERSITY: 

At The York School, our mission is to develop inquiring, knowledgeable and caring young people who are engaged citizens of the world. As such, we are an equal opportunity employer and encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We are committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace. The York School will provide support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant’s accessibility needs. If you require accommodation during the interview process, please contact Human Resources by email at yorkhr@yorkschool.com or by phone at 416- 926-1325. 


HOW TO APPLY:

All qualified candidates are encouraged to submit their letter of application and resume via email to yorkhr@yorkschool.com by May 6, 2022. Please reference the position you are applying for in the subject line. We thank all candidates for their applications; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:

As a well-established and reputable global organization, CINEC Education Group utilizes effective educational practices, gains recognition for accomplishments, attracts qualified staff, facilitates student connections with leading universities around the world, and provides a quality international education experience to students and parents.

title: Early Childhood Educator
description:
West Moberly First Nations is located 35 minutes/40 kms northwest of Chetwynd, BC at the west end of Moberly Lake. The area is surrounded by the lake, rivers, trees, and mountains. Our community values its mission which is to positively enhance the procession of West Moberly First Nations ethics with respect, honesty, fairness, integrity, and self motivation by promoting open communication with members, Chief & Council and staff.  

Our early childcare program focuses on holistic child development. Our philosophy is to support healthy child development in the areas of physical, social, emotional, intellectual, language and spiritual growth. 


About the position

The successful applicant will work alongside an Early Years childcare team supporting the development and implementation of the West Moberly First Nations (WMFN) Dakii Yadze Centre, a licensed Multi Age Care Program, primarily serving ages 12 months to 5 years. This program operates in accordance with the Community Care Facility Act. This is a full time position with an average of 35 hours/week from Monday to Thursday & alternating Fridays.


The Successful Candidate

You will preferably have experience working in a First Nations community with knowledge of cultural practices or a keen interest in the culture, however not mandatory. You have a zest for play-based learning, outdoor education and working knowledge of the BC Early Learning Framework.

Your toolkit will bring:

  • Self motivation with strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • An engaging style who works well as part of a team and is also able to work independently.
  • Certificate required, or willingness to enroll in the ECE/ECEA online/local courses
  • Courses, training or education in a relevant field (child development, child guidance, health, safety & nutrition)
  • Childcare First Aid (or willingness to obtain) as specified by Community Care Facility Act
  • Relevant work experience in an educational setting (i.e. teacher, teacher assistant, volunteer, daycare)
  • Experience working with both children and their families/guardians
  • Knowledge of child development and the various stages of development
  • Knowledge of Aboriginal culture and experience working in First Nations community
  • Must be 19 years of age
  • Clean Vulnerable Sector Criminal Records Check.

title: Registered Massage Therapist RMT
description:
Considering a change and just checking out what other practice locations are out there? Or perhaps trying to decide where to start up your career? We invite you to take 2 minutes to read this post as some food for thought.


Yes, Hand and Stone Burlington is a big location, we have 7 treatment rooms offering Registered Massage Therapy, and that takes a certain amount of staff. For some, this is not a fit, and we understand, but please allow us to share a different perspective.
Hand and Stone Burlington is easily one of, if not the number one, go to place for Registered Massage Therapy in Burlington and surrounding areas. We've been in the community for nearly 10 years and have a great reputation (Google us to be sure). Clients know they have access to a variety of providers with various techniques and strengths, so having different staff to find their match with is a huge asset and brings them in to us. Additionally, clients know they can call and get in to see an RMT within 24 hours when needed, be it for an acute or nagging concern, to relieve accumulating stress, or spoil themselves, so that means you will see variety in your day.
Yes, we're a busy location, BUT, we're a busy location. You can let go of that stress of having to market yourself, or worry whether you will make the income you require, or be bored day after day, week after week without being able to do what you trained hard to become. That would be kind of nice, wouldn't it?
So, why not give us a call and find out a bit more. Not every location is run by the same owner, and this one is not like the others.  There's a reason we're the number ONE Spa, year after year.
 
We have all kinds of other stuff to tell you about how you can make up to $1400 per week, before gratuities, working 25 appointments, or how our computer system lets you check your schedule or make notes from your phone, or how if you're a new grad you can get your CMTO and licensing fees paid for up front, or how we'll pay you to learn Himalayan salt stone and hot stone treatments, decompression therapy/cupping, prenatal massage and lots more, as well as tons of other great stuff, but you'll need to reach out first. A phone conversation with us just might be the change you're looking for. 
If you're not an RMT yet, and are nervous about completing your licensing tests (MCQ and OSCE), we can help you with that too.  We are partnered with a great company that offers a prep course to help you succeed, and we pay for this course for you - a $475 value.  Just reach out to us to learn how.  We want to support you and see you succeed.

What it's like to work at Hand & Stone Burlington:
-Start your day with a friendly smile from out front desk team and a quick covid screen (done for all staff everyday to ensure your safety),
-review your clients on our computers, tablets, or your phone,
-take your client from our lobby to your treatment room,
-perform your unique massage treatment,
-sign the insurance receipt that has been prepared for you in a folder at the front desk,
-remake the table (with help from our cleaning team when possible) using linens stocked in the room for you,
-leave the used linens in laundry bins where they are laundered, folded and restocked in the treatment room for you,
-make a treatment note (again from your phone, tablet, or computer), and
-collect your next client (or head home, if it's the end of your day). 

That's it.  Your clients are booked, welcomed, prescreened, rebooked, and invoiced for you by our front desk team that care deeply about customer service, without any additional charges or deductions from your pay.

description:
Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)

Our award-winning multidisciplinary clinic is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to join our growing team.

Are you a team player who is great at building relationships and passionate about helping others? If so, we want you to join our dynamic group of healthcare professionals.  Our therapists are Burnaby's leading back, knee, and neck pain specialists, and dedicated to helping our patients get back to living a life they love.  As our Registered Massage Therapist, you will have the opportunity to grow your skills and learn from top physicians in a multidisciplinary clinic environment.

Responsibilities

  • Provide 30, 45, and 60-minute deep tissue, relaxation, and pre/post-natal massages using techniques such as myofascial release, trigger point release, and joint mobilization
  • Execute clinical assessments and implement treatment plans for clients
  • Monitor client progress and provide ongoing evaluation
  • Communicate important information and educate clients on treatment strategies
  • Keep accurate, up-to-date clinical records
  • Work with other therapists and external stakeholders as needed
  • Participate in continuous learning to further enhance skills
  • Ability to work through situations with professionalism and confidentiality

Skills and Experience

  • Registered member and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of BC (CMTBC)
  • Massage Therapy Certification from College of Massage Therapy diploma program
  • Experience and/or interest in pre-and post-natal massage
  • Relevant experience is an asset
  • New graduates are welcome to apply

Hours

Hours are flexible and can be discussed in-person

About Royal Treatment Therapeutics

Located in South Burnaby, Royal Treatment Therapeutics is a multidisciplinary wellness centre passionate about outstanding patient care.  We offer a variety of services including massage therapy, physiotherapy, chiropractic, acupuncture, Traditional Chinese Medicine, and more.  All our practitioners are registered in their respective fields and dedicated to providing exceptional care in a warm and welcoming environment.  Whether a patient is seeking pain relief, stress reduction, or relaxation, we make it our mission to provide the "royal treatment" at our award-winning clinic.

Why work with Us

  • Comprehensive and competitive compensation package
  • Flexible work schedules so you can set your own hours
  • Access to our portfolio of clients
  • A multidisciplinary team who refers patients internally to other therapists
  • Full-time reception and billing services
  • Online booking with Jane App allows you to see your schedule from anywhere
  • Benefit from our in-house marketing team with digital and print ads promoting you and your services
  • All supplies provided including on-site linen and laundry services

Registered Massage Therapist

Status: Contract - 0.4 FTE

Location: TELUS Health - Care Centres

Join our team

TELUS Health - Care Centres is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to support our Centre. We also are open to working with individuals that are interested in any of our sites, including Edmonton, Vancouver and North Vancouver.

This position provides an exciting, “lifestyle friendly” opportunity in a dynamic setting. We are certain that you will find the organization provides a welcoming and progressive workplace and we are deeply committed to introducing innovations in healthcare delivery for the benefit of our clients. Within this role, the Massage Therapists play a key role in our team environment. If you are eager to develop professionally, diversify and grow your client base, contribute to expanding the business and continuously market the Centre, we are looking for you.

Here's how

As part of the team, you'll be responsible for:

  • Performing clinical assessments, setting goals and providing treatment plans for clients
  • Initiating appropriate treatment intervention based on clinical assessment
  • Providing ongoing evaluation of client progress
  • Administering and collecting outcome measurement information
  • Participating in quality improvement initiatives
  • Collaborating with our interdisciplinary healthcare team
  • Communicating to appropriate referral sources and stakeholders

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

Experience / Knowledge:

  • 2200 hours of training or equivalent
  • Three to five years’ experience in healthcare setting utilizing health charting
  • Proficient in assessment and treatment planning
  • Knowledge and proficiency in various massage therapy techniques (therapeutic, relaxation and pregnancy are assets)

Skills and Abilities:

  • Outstanding customer and massage services
  • Punctual, and strong time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an interdisciplinary team environment
  • Computer competency and familiarity with an EMR - MedAccess

Professional / Designation Certification:

  • Registered with the College of Massage Therapists of Alberta RMT association and in good standing
  • Graduate from an accredited school of massage

Work Conditions / Physical Requirements:

  • You will be working in a multi-disciplinary clinical setting. Typical office hours throughout weekdays only, however, some flexibility may be required to accommodate service requirements for the operation to extend outside of standard business hours during these days.
  • Physical strength, endurance and overall health is of utmost importance to perform the job consistently and effectively throughout the week as most of the day will require multiple hours of standing, pressing, lunging or bending as well as stretching or assisting clients;
  • You will be working in an office environment, which may require extended periods of time completing computer related work in between treatments. You will work an eight hour day with an additional minimum of half hour for lunch as well as a scheduled 15 minute break between clients to allow for timely changeover and sanitization of room and equipment.

Who is TELUS Health - Care Centres?

We are a national network of renowned medical professionals dedicated to identifying health risks, inspiring positive lifestyle choices and improving patient outcomes. We have one of the largest networks of Care Centres in Canada.

Our commitment: Better healthcare options for everyone. We are leveraging the power of technology to provide Canadians with better health outcomes. Connecting health teams, streamlining workflows, and empowering patients to manage their health are just some of the ways our digital solutions promote collaboration and efficiency.

We are looking for enthusiastic, customer service minded individuals who want to work in a collaborative, friendly and supportive environment. Join our team and help us shape the future of how Canadians engage with the healthcare ecosystem.

Accessibility

TELUS Health is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process. Please let the recruitment team know of any accommodation requirement at the beginning of the process.

Please note that we are exclusively recruiting people who can work legally in Canada.

If you meet the qualifications and feel you can help achieve excellence in the quality of care we provide, we would be very interested in talking to you. Please submit your resume and cover letter on our website, https://www.telus.com/en/health/care-centres, under the Careers tab.

Thank you!

70/30 split

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Must be a Registered Massage Therapist and a member of the College of Massage
Therapists of Ontario.
 
LANGUAGE SKILLS
English Mandatory

70/30 split

Love helping people? We're looking for diverse and equity minded passionate, hardworking, and self-directed people to join our team of caregivers. Spark Inc is an innovative and award-winning inclusive and equity focused organization that matches diverse clients to the best one to one care in the community.  

 
REGISTERED MASSAGE THERAPIST
Our clients are looking for Massage Therapy Services in the Ottawa area. We are looking for Registered Massage Therapists to provide treatment  in our Centretown clinic and/or mobile therapy. Team-oriented Registered Massage Therapists who have interests in helping people with complex cases would be the best fit.  

We are excited to work with you because: 

  • You appreciate a tech forward workplace.
  • You have demonstrated skills and interest in clinical treatment.
  • You are interested in working collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team.
  • You are a team player who wants to improve people's lives. 
 
HOURS
Flexible scheduling available with individual control over booking clients
 
RATE OF PAY
70% of all billables
Additional paid travel time for mobile treatments

Requirements:

  • Registration in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario
  • Proof of Professional Liability Insurance (minimum of $2 million) 
  • If interested in mobile therapy, a valid driver's license and access to a reliable vehicle
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong time management skills, ability to work independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team
  • Demonstrated understanding and adherence to appropriate community health regulations

Why Spark?

  • Competitive compensation as well as frequent and repeat clientele
  • Flexible caseload and independent management over your own schedule 
  • Guaranteed monthly pay
  • Access and coverage to Jane for online booking, billing, and digital charting for a 100% paperless experience
  • Direct billing capabilities 
  • Experience working within the MVA (motor vehicle accident) system and competitive compensation with free access to HCAI
  • On-site laundry and linens 
  • Hydraulic tables 
  • Access to Care Specialists with expertise in a variety of areas, including business development and tax management, chronic pain, brain injury as well as diversity and equity.
  • Supportive full-time administrative team
  • Clients to complement existing practice and clientele

We would love to hear from new graduates! 

 

Therapy is tailored to each person, so each position is unique. Whatever the circumstances, we want people who will genuinely care about their wellbeing.

At Spark, we value community, work life balance and career development. To help foster your personal and professional growth, we partner with Spark University, a non-profit focused on connecting, educating, and empowering caregivers. Spark U provides you with learning opportunities to make sure you are providing quality care for your clients. You can check them out at www.sparku.ca

Whatever our clients' age, background, or circumstances, we help them choose the perfect fit from our handpicked team of passionate, skilled and committed care providers. As a care provider with Spark, you have a voice in the matching process. We believe that your input will foster the best long-term relationships with your clients. At Spark, you'll have flexibility, autonomy and a team who truly cares about you.

Whatever your age, ability, orientation, ethnicity, race, culture, religion or gender identity - you are welcome. Our community is stronger and more vibrant when it is more diverse.

Check us out: www.sparkcares.ca

description:
OR1, OR1 and ASTD programs

1 Part-time position working 22.5 hrs/week

Coquitlam

 

Come and work with an amazing team to make a real difference in people’s lives

Back in Motion is a multiple award winning employer with a culture of excellence, mutual respect, integrity, teamwork, and commitment to people.

Our employees enjoy flexible working conditions within an environment of growth and development.  We preferentially hire from within for new opportunities and leadership roles.  We have a diverse and inclusive team, and are stronger because of our unique experiences and perspectives.

Under the direction of the Rehab Services Manager, the Kinesiologist works within a multidisciplinary team and assist clients with return to work and improve their quality of life.

You will:

  • Provides daily supervision and support to clients to implement and progress exercise and stretching programs as well as work simulation programs.

  • At least 1 year of experience as a Kinesiologist within a similar responsible role and in a related type of work setting.

We invite Kinesiologists interested to send a resume or contact us in HR for more information.

This approach created an environment that encouraged dialogue with patients and noted their needs and wants. With these founding principles, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to life.

Status: Contract - 0.4 FTE

Location: TELUS Health - Care Centres

Join our team

TELUS Health - Care Centres is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to support our Centre. We also are open to working with individuals that are interested in any of our sites, including Edmonton, Vancouver and North Vancouver.

This position provides an exciting, “lifestyle friendly” opportunity in a dynamic setting. We are certain that you will find the organization provides a welcoming and progressive workplace and we are deeply committed to introducing innovations in healthcare delivery for the benefit of our clients. Within this role, the Massage Therapists play a key role in our team environment. If you are eager to develop professionally, diversify and grow your client base, contribute to expanding the business and continuously market the Centre, we are looking for you.

Here's how

As part of the team, you'll be responsible for:

  • Performing clinical assessments, setting goals and providing treatment plans for clients
  • Initiating appropriate treatment intervention based on clinical assessment
  • Providing ongoing evaluation of client progress
  • Administering and collecting outcome measurement information
  • Participating in quality improvement initiatives
  • Collaborating with our interdisciplinary healthcare team
  • Communicating to appropriate referral sources and stakeholders

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

Experience / Knowledge:

  • 2200 hours of training or equivalent
  • Three to five years' experience in healthcare setting utilizing health charting
  • Proficient in assessment and treatment planning
  • Knowledge and proficiency in various massage therapy techniques (therapeutic, relaxation and pregnancy are assets)

Skills and Abilities:

  • Outstanding customer and massage services
  • Punctual, and strong time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an interdisciplinary team environment
  • Computer competency and familiarity with an EMR - MedAccess

Professional / Designation Certification:

  • Registered with the College of Massage Therapists of Alberta RMT association and in good standing
  • Graduate from an accredited school of massage

Work Conditions / Physical Requirements:

  • You will be working in a multi-disciplinary clinical setting. Typical office hours throughout weekdays only, however, some flexibility may be required to accommodate service requirements for the operation to extend outside of standard business hours during these days.
  • Physical strength, endurance and overall health is of utmost importance to perform the job consistently and effectively throughout the week as most of the day will require multiple hours of standing, pressing, lunging or bending as well as stretching or assisting clients;
  • You will be working in an office environment, which may require extended periods of time completing computer related work in between treatments. You will work an eight hour day with an additional minimum of half hour for lunch as well as a scheduled 15 minute break between clients to allow for timely changeover and sanitization of room and equipment.

Who is TELUS Health - Care Centres?

We are a national network of renowned medical professionals dedicated to identifying health risks, inspiring positive lifestyle choices and improving patient outcomes. We have one of the largest networks of Care Centres in Canada.

Our commitment: Better healthcare options for everyone. We are leveraging the power of technology to provide Canadians with better health outcomes. Connecting health teams, streamlining workflows, and empowering patients to manage their health are just some of the ways our digital solutions promote collaboration and efficiency.

We are looking for enthusiastic, customer service minded individuals who want to work in a collaborative, friendly and supportive environment. Join our team and help us shape the future of how Canadians engage with the healthcare ecosystem.

Accessibility

TELUS Health is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process. Please let the recruitment team know of any accommodation requirement at the beginning of the process.

Please note that we are exclusively recruiting people who can work legally in Canada.

If you meet the qualifications and feel you can help achieve excellence in the quality of care we provide, we would be very interested in talking to you. Please submit your resume and cover letter on our website, https://www.telus.com/en/health/care-centres, under the Careers tab.

Thank you!

description:
Registered Massage Therapist

Status: Part Time

Location: TELUS Health - Care Centres

Join our team

TELUS Health - Care Centres is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to support our Centre. We also are open to working with individuals that are interested in any of our sites, including Edmonton, Vancouver and North Vancouver.

This position provides an exciting, “lifestyle friendly” opportunity in a dynamic setting. We are certain that you will find the organization provides a welcoming and progressive workplace and we are deeply committed to introducing innovations in healthcare delivery for the benefit of our clients. Within this role, the Massage Therapists play a key role in our team environment. If you are eager to develop professionally, diversify and grow your client base, contribute to expanding the business and continuously market the Centre, we are looking for you.

Here's how

As part of the team, you'll be responsible for:

  • Performing clinical assessments, setting goals and providing treatment plans for clients
  • Initiating appropriate treatment intervention based on clinical assessment
  • Providing ongoing evaluation of client progress
  • Administering and collecting outcome measurement information
  • Participating in quality improvement initiatives
  • Collaborating with our interdisciplinary healthcare team
  • Communicating to appropriate referral sources and stakeholders

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

Experience / Knowledge:

  • 2200 hours of training or equivalent
  • Three to five years' experience in healthcare setting utilizing health charting
  • Proficient in assessment and treatment planning
  • Knowledge and proficiency in various massage therapy techniques (therapeutic, relaxation and pregnancy are assets)

Skills and Abilities:

  • Outstanding customer and massage services
  • Punctual, and strong time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an interdisciplinary team environment
  • Computer competency and familiarity with an EMR - MedAccess

Professional / Designation Certification:

  • Registered with the College of Massage Therapists of Alberta RMT association and in good standing
  • Graduate from an accredited school of massage

Work Conditions / Physical Requirements:

  • You will be working in a multi-disciplinary clinical setting. Typical office hours throughout weekdays only, however, some flexibility may be required to accommodate service requirements for the operation to extend outside of standard business hours during these days.
  • Physical strength, endurance and overall health is of utmost importance to perform the job consistently and effectively throughout the week as most of the day will require multiple hours of standing, pressing, lunging or bending as well as stretching or assisting clients;
  • You will be working in an office environment, which may require extended periods of time completing computer related work in between treatments. You will work an eight hour day with an additional minimum of half hour for lunch as well as a scheduled 15 minute break between clients to allow for timely changeover and sanitization of room and equipment.

Who is TELUS Health - Care Centres?

We are a national network of renowned medical professionals dedicated to identifying health risks, inspiring positive lifestyle choices and improving patient outcomes. We have one of the largest networks of Care Centres in Canada.

Our commitment: Better healthcare options for everyone. We are leveraging the power of technology to provide Canadians with better health outcomes. Connecting health teams, streamlining workflows, and empowering patients to manage their health are just some of the ways our digital solutions promote collaboration and efficiency.

We are looking for enthusiastic, customer service minded individuals who want to work in a collaborative, friendly and supportive environment. Join our team and help us shape the future of how Canadians engage with the healthcare ecosystem.

Accessibility

TELUS Health is proud to foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to fair employment practices and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We offer accommodation for applicants with disabilities, as required, during the recruitment process. Please let the recruitment team know of any accommodation requirement at the beginning of the process.

Please note that we are exclusively recruiting people who can work legally in Canada.

If you meet the qualifications and feel you can help achieve excellence in the quality of care we provide, we would be very interested in talking to you. Please submit your resume and cover letter on our website, https://www.telus.com/en/health/care-centres, under the Careers tab.

Thank you!

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, we will only contact with those selected for an interview.
